name: Join into an Object (with topics as keys)
Click to see explanation
info:
The input simply has the name of the valve as its payload, e.g. "Fertilizer A". At the prompt of the input, each of the Modbus getters reads its value and passes it in the message payload. We then set the topic of the message to the appropriate property, e.g. alarm or status.

Afterwards, each of these messages are joined together by topic into one Object. The topic becomes the key and the payload becomes the value.

If any of the readers meet an error, they will return an undefined payload. If a payload is undefined, it is set as an empty string or 0.0, depending on the data type.

name: name
func: return msg;

name: alarm topic
real_time_flow topic
real_time_flow_unit topic

total_flow topic
total_flow_unit topic
valve_type topic
name topic

msg.topic = "name"
return msg;

msg.attribute_offset = 16;
return msg;

name: real_time_pressure
Main_Pump_01: block_addr=2500
func:
msg.payload = {
    alarm: 0,
    real_time_flow: 0,
    real_time_flow_unit: "m³/h",
    real_time_pressure: 0,
    real_time_pressure_unit: "bar",
    status: 0,
    total_flow: 1,
    total_flow_unit: "m³/h",
    valve_type: "main pump",
    name: "Main_Pump_01",
    timestamp: ""
}
msg.block_addr = 2500;
return msg;

name: Each property of the object is set an attribute_offset. Address is calculated by adding the block address (starting address of the block) to this offset.

Subflow to read a series of floats at a certain address (see more inside)
info:
The property names of these floats may be structured, for example, as follows:

"total_fertilizer01_flow"
ranging to
"total_fertilizer15_flow"

This subflow requires the following arguments:
- msg.label: a two-item array. In this case label[0] = "total_fertilizer" and label[1] = "_flow". These are joined to the number in between at the end.
- msg.float_count: The number of floats to read. In this case it is 15.
- msg.block_addr and msg.offset are used the same way as in other flows to find the address of our values.

After reading from the Modbus an array of integers, each pair of integers is converted to a float. The subflow outputs an object with properties. The keys of these properties are for example "total_fertilizer_xx_flow" and the value is the xxth float.

name: Rounding out a float read
info: This is necessary because when we read from the Modbus a pair of integers and then convert them to float, the float is off by a tiny amount, making a long decimal number which is ugly to store. I therefore round them out to 3 decimal places.

name: A reusable subflow to format and write date (details inside)
info:
The input date is parsed into year, month, day, hour, and minute. We write each of these integers into a sequence of words.

We calculate the address with the inputs msg.block_addr and msg.attribute_offset. These two values are added to get the address.

name: Eureka: set block_addr to 1000
info: Can be found as BLOCK1 in PLC

func: rbe

func: rbe

name: Block unless value changes
info: RBE is used because so many values are being written and it is unnecessary to write the same values every few seconds.

name: set block_addr to wherever these BLOCKs are
info: For example, Eureka's values can be found starting fomr %MW1000, and it is BLOCK1, so we set its msg.block_addr to 1000.
